conclusion: Analyze forces and motion of charged particles in electric field to determine voltage U1.
Particles are negatively charged and move through a uniform electric field directed vertically between plates.
Electric force on each particle is F = -alpha E.
Particles have initial horizontal velocity v0 due to airflow.
Particles experience downward acceleration a = -alpha E / m due to electric field.
Time to traverse plates horizontally is t = L / v0.
Vertical displacement y after time t is y = alpha E L^2 / (2 m v0^2).
Condition for complete collection is y = d, leading to E = 2 m v0^2 d / (alpha L^2).
Voltage U1 between plates is U1 = E * d = 2 m v0^2 d^2 / (alpha L^2).
Final answer: U1 = 2 m v0^2 d^2 / (alpha L^2).
